page.title: 01EARLS COLNE,COLNE ENGAINE
page.content: Our survey area,in North West Essex has two villages in it, Earls Colne and Colne Engaine. Earls Colne is the larger of the two, while Colne Engaine is the smaller. The countryside contains rolling areas, mainly farmland. The housing ranges from modern day dwellings, way back to Elizabethan style cottages. There is not much woodland in our area, except for a small part of Chalkney Woods down in the South East corner. The farmland areas contain non grass crops and grass crops. Other farming areas include crops for King Seeds in Coggeshall. Small clumps of trees are scattered out around the survey grid, with a wide range of names. Our area is generally country side, apart from the two villages, Earls Colne and Colne Engaine.
